listitem.para: Adds support for ScaLAPACK (Scalable Linear Algebra PACKage) on the RHEL 6.3 and CentOS 6.3 platforms. Previously, this support was available for Ubuntu 12.04 only.
Significantly improves the performance of selected operators such as redimension and redimension_store.
Adds a Best Practices section to the SciDB User Guide that provides guidelines on performance tuning for your SciDB installation.

article.para:
The 13.1 release has the following known limitations:
Support for non-integer dimensions is incomplete: it works only for selected operators, and may use a large amount of memory. Reducing the number of instances per node may help.
Among the integer types, only int64 is considered an integer when deciding whether non-integer dimensions should be used. So, for instance, if your array has an int32 dimension, SciDB treats it as a non-integer dimension. Consider using int64 as dimension types.
Some operators may consume more memory than specified. Plan to leave margins when specifying the parameters controlling memory usage.
Strings with quotations may not be loaded correctly.
If you have questions or comments, please contact support@paradigm4.com.
